citeinfo.origin: Data developed under contract by VESTRA Resources, Inc
citeinfo.title: PCTL_Clip

descript.abstract: A 1:100,000 polygon features class representing public, conservation and trust land ownership in the state of California. Developed for the California Resources Agency's Legacy Project, this dataset depicts ownership features as submitted by major public, trust, and non-profit groups in the state. This dataset is an update to the Legacy Project's govconfee03_3 geographic dataset, which built on a prior effort by the USBR to map public lands (GOVLANDS dataset).
descript.purpose: The California Legacy Project is an initiative by the California Resources Agency to help state agencies and the state's conservation partners make better decisions about how to conserve precious natural resources. This Public, Conservation and Trust Lands dataset is part of a number of geographic datasets developed for this initiative, and is intended to provide stakeholders in both the public and private sectors with a planning-level representation of ownership in California.
descript.supplinf: THIS LAYER MUST NOT BE USED FOR PARCEL OR PROPERTY BOUNDARY MAPPING OR ANALYSIS. This version cannot be considered final, and is continually subject to review and update by contributing groups and/or agencies. It is intended to provide GENERAL ownership information for conservation and other planning purposes. This dataset was compiled by VESTRA Resources, Inc, under contract to the California Resources Agency

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

idinfo.useconst: To be used for general planning use only, and not for property boundary or parcel mapping. 1:100,000 scale and smaller use ONLY.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

attracc.attraccr: Attribute information was imported directly from source contributor data, and fit into the PCTL framework. Attributes such as data sources and coordinate accuracy were derived from contributor metadata, and are as accurate as that agency's description.

dataqual.logic: All polygons are closed, and no dangles exist. Topological rules were defined between features, ensuring that polygons do not overlap, and do not have gaps (slivers).
dataqual.complete: At this release, dataset does NOT contain: Tribal lands Incomplete but included are: Local government lands Land trust / non-profit groups

horizpa.horizpar: Data is considered accurate at 1:100,000 mapping scale, and no larger. Feature boundaries were maintained as received from source contributors, except where resolved for overlaps, gaps or against the state boundary. Much of the source data is at 1:24,000 scale; please see source information for specific details.

citeinfo.origin: California Department of Parks and Recreation
Gary Walter, ed. Tel: (916) 651-6941 Email: GWALT@parks.ca.gov
citeinfo.title: UTM83z10.stprk_parcel.shp
citeinfo.othercit: The data received from the CDPR came projected to California Albers, and was a shapefile named stprksalb27.shp. The metadata received refers to the original UTM zone 10 file. "Parcel boundaries are approximate and should not be considered legal descriptions. Maps are intended for study purposes only."

srcinfo.srccontr: California Department of Parks and Recreation GIS representation of park units and subunits for planning purposes. State park boundaries as delineated on 7.5' USGS quads by Survey Section. This is an interim dataset where QA-QC is not complete.

citeinfo.title: r5admn02_1
citeinfo.othercit: "Not suggested for use at scales larger than 1:24,000"

srcinfo.srccontr: Polygon features of Administrative Boundaries for the National Forests of Region 5 (Pacific Southwest Region), USDA Forest Service. Ownership (Forest/Non-Forest) is coded for land parcels that lie within National Forest boundaries.

citeinfo.origin: California Department of Fish and Game
Craig Turner, ed. Tel: (916) 445-3542 Email: cturner@dfg.ca.gov
citeinfo.title: dfg_lands
citeinfo.othercit: "This coverage does not provide legal determination of parcel acreages. Legal parcel acreages are based on County Assessor records. Users should contact WIFD/LFB, Lands Program for this information and related data."

srcinfo.srccontr: A digitized geographical inventory of selected lands administered and/or owned by the California Department of Fish and Game (CDFG). Properties such as ecological reserves, wildlife areas, undesignated lands, public and fishing access lands, and DFG hatcheries are among those lands included in this inventory. Physical boundaries of individual parcels are determined by the descriptions contained in legal documents and assessor parcel maps relating to that parcel. Parcel boundaries are drawn to USGS 7.5' series topographic maps.

citeinfo.origin: James Scrivner, GIS Coordinator, ed. Tel: (916) 978-4559 Email: jscrivne@ca.blm.gov
citeinfo.title: ownpca

srcinfo.srccontr: The ownpca data is intended to illustrate state wide and regional land ownership. Large land holders are emphasized in detail and they are Federal, State, and local governments. These data are owned and maintained by the Bureau of Land Management, and are not to be used at scales greater than 1:24,000.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Bureau of Land Management, California Office
James Scrivner, GIS Coordinator, ed. Tel: (916) 978-4559 Email: jscrivne@ca.blm.gov
citeinfo.title: ownpcablm

srcinfo.srccontr: This is a dataset depicting BLM administered lands in California, derived from a set of one degree tiles of all ownership within California. These data are public information and may be used and interpreted by organizations, government agencies or others. These data are intended for small scale mapping, and should not be used at larger scales.

citeinfo.origin: Matt Merrifield, ed. Tel: (415) 281-0475 Email: mmerrifield@tnc.org
citeinfo.title: ca_tnccfe062603.shp
citeinfo.othercit: This dataset is constantly being updated, and for that reason can never be considered final. It must therefore always be considered a draft dataset.

srcinfo.srccontr: Geographic dataset representing lands owned in fee or easement by The Nature Conservancy in California. Data developed from multiple sources, with no single scale denominator. For this reason, this dataset can be used for general mapping and planning purposes ONLY, and at scales no larger than 1:100,000.

citeinfo.origin: Contact: Dave Hoy, Cartographer tel. (503) 231-2230 email. david_hoy@fws.gov
David Drescher, GIS & Cartography Branch Supervisor Tel: (503) 231-6196 Email: David_Drescher@r1.fws.gov
citeinfo.title: merge_bnd.shp
citeinfo.othercit: USFWS refuge boundaries are maintained by the contributor in individual ArcInfo coverage format. Data was received in shapefile format, with all of the individual files merged together.

srcinfo.srccontr: This geographic dataset depicts boundary information for National Wildlife Refuge lands owned and/or managed by the US Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 1 Division of Refuge Planning. This data is intended to serve as spatial refernece for other data layers in GIS and mapping applications, and is NOT appropriate for legal purposes. It was developed according to USGS 7.5' mapping standards.

citeinfo.title: coast24a
citeinfo.othercit: California State Lands Commission Environmental Planning Division 1807 13th Street Sacramento, California 95814-7187 (916) 574-1880

srcinfo.srccontr: Depicts the California coastline from the Oregon border to the Mexico border, including Humboldt, Arcata, San Francisco, San Pablo, Suisun, Honker, and San Diego Bays. This dataset was developed by the State Lands Commission, compiled from the USGS 1:24,000 topographic map series.

Modified/updated version of the US Bureau of Reclamation county boundary, as completed by the California Department of Conservation. Corrections were made to three county boundaries by the DOC: Orange-Riverside, Santa Clara-Santa Cruz, and Butte-Glenn.

procstep.procdesc: Data was received from contributing agencies and converted to ArcGIS geodatabase featureclass format, using ArcCatalog. Feature classes were then projected (if necessary) to the California Albers projection, and the attributes mapped to the PCTL structure. Feature dataset precision was set to 1000.

Within ArcCatalog, a set of topological rules were established between each of the contributor datasets to ensure that features did not overlap. At this point, gaps were left for a later process step. Overlapping areas were resolved according to the coordinate source of the contributed datasets, in conjunction with the BLM Public Land Survey township/range and section layer. The ArcGIS 8.3 topology tools were used, in conjunction with ArcSDE on SQL Server (to enable a multi-editor environment) to resolve overlaps.
Once overlaps were resolved between contributed datasets, these were integrated/merged together. Data was loaded with the data loader in ArcCatalog into a single feature class.

The former version of the public ownership layer (govconfee03_3) was then queried for agency/other data that was not updated. These layers were then also loaded into the updated dataset with the data loader. Topology rules were created for features in this dataset, to ensure that the new and old features did not overlap.

The official coastline and county boundaries were received, and integrated to create a new boundary for the state. This boundary was then integrated with the updated ownership feature class. Topology was again defined to ensure that coastal features were coincident with the state boundary.

Once the coastline was integrated with the ownership features, topology rules were defined to ensure that gaps (slivers) did not exist between updated features. Again, the BLM PLS was used as a reference to determine how to resolve slivers.
The feature class was exported to both shapefile and coverage formats, from ArcCatalog. Also exported were look-up-tables for the data source and coordinate source of the features.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Commonly used name for property, if it exists
Name of administrative area that property is part of, if applicable
Agency or group that possesses PRIMARY ownership rights to the property. Driven by the OWNERSHIP domain, and used as a primary key to the CA_Owners table
Accepted abbreviation for primary owning entity. Driven by the OWNER_ABBRV domain
PRIMATY managing group or agency for property. Driven by the MANAGEMENT domain.
Date that the feature was last updated/edited within the ownership dataset

Numeric code indicating the source for the data. Driven by the DATA_SOURCE domain, and used to link to the Data_Source table, which holds detailed contact and coordinate source information about each contributed dataset
Categorization indicating general administrative level of owning entity. Driven by the MAINGROUP domain
ID number or code to link back to the source dataset
Date that property transaction was recorded with the county assessor.
Date that property was mapped into the source contributor's GIS database.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

cntaddr.city: REQUIRED: The city of the address.
cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.
